meanings.definition: A person who takes advantage of opportunities as and when they arise.
meanings.sent1: The opportunists seized the chance to buy the last ticket to the concert.
meanings.sent2: The opportunists in the business world always keep an eye out for new ventures.
meanings.sent3: The opportunists at the party were quick to grab the last slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: Like bees to flowers, the opportunists flocked to the newly opened store for discounts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the opportunists hunting for bargains was etched in her mind.

meanings.definition: A person who exploits circumstances to gain immediate advantage.
meanings.sent1: The opportunists saw the chaos as a chance to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, opportunists often emerge to take advantage of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The opportunists at the office party managed to get the best seats by the stage.
meanings.sent4: The storm was a feast for the opportunists seeking to sell umbrellas at a high price.
meanings.sent5: The image of the opportunists scavenging for resources in the ruins was haunting.
